body: Let's close it as definitely looks like a typo in github flow :-)
Closing as merged into @snazy's integration branch.
Thanks @joaquincasares :)

Could you address this @joaquincasares? 

Thank you!

Super sorry for the delay! I edited the file in Github and didn't realize that the text was correct and that Github does not use a monospaced font!

I've submitted #91 to fix the issues. Thanks for pointing it out @ifesdjeen !

This is a simple fix for when you query with CONTAINS and the collection is empty (which ends up as null in the database) ... this is a blocking issue for my company so would appreciate if it could get into the next release.

Hi @MikkelTAndersen. Apache Cassandra does not use pull requests on github. Please use JIRA directly.

You can get more information on the contribution process here https://wiki.apache.org/cassandra/HowToContribute
@MikkelTAndersen Could you also add some unit tests to your patch?

I will see what you have already then : )

You can look into `org.apache.cassandra.cql3.validation.entities.SecondaryIndexTest` for some examples. It is where you test should go.

Otherwise just generate a patch using: `git format-patch` and attach the output to the JIRA ticket. I guess that the problem must be there since 3.0 so the patch should be for this version.

If anything is missing please let me know and I will fix it asap...

Looks like this was committed as 0eebc6e6b7cd7fc801579e57701608e7bf155ee0 - please do close the PR when you can (the project is unable to close it for you, which is one of the reasons we tend not to use GH PRs).

This pull request is unlikely to be merged in its current state. These changes seem scattered - there are a lot of asserts in the form that you changed, and a lot of comments in the form you changed, but you've only changed one of each, and they appear unrelated. It also has an unnecessary empty file (.toDelete), which we wouldn't want to merge.

Finally, we really prefer JIRA tickets for non-trivial changes. I encourage you to close this pull request, as the project can not close it for you. Please see http://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/development/patches.html for details.
Merging for now...
This was committed as 470f15be652ffb3c471161d6fb10c8893ff59e46 - mind closing the PR?
The JIRA ticket ID which references this PR : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-13486
Added license file as was suggested in JIRA ticket : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-13486.
Applied the fix to resolve the error faced during unit test case execution : https://builds.apache.org/view/A-D/view/Cassandra/job/cassandra-devbranch-ppc64le-testall/8/console

1. Last fix was for adding capiflash emulation to "capiblock.jar" this will make validating capiflash code on any machine - power /x86 
To run the unit test case , will need to set below
export JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS="-DCAPI_DEVICE_PATH=<a file name here> -Dcom.ibm.research.capiblock.verbose=true -Dcom.ibm.research.capiblock.emulation=true -Dcom.ibm.research.capiblock.capacity=26214400" 

Next unit test case: CapiCacheProviderTest.java should pass.

2. Also removed hard coded path of capiflash in conf/jvm.options and CapiCacheProviderTest.java

Hi Harshraj - this would be a great question for the dev@cassandra.apache.org mailing list. Generally speaking such optimizations would be appreciated as long as it matches code style and doesn't break published interfaces/APIs.

Hi @piyushknoldus Thank you for the patch. We had a *very* detailed page about gossip at one point, but that did not survive the transfer to the new site for some reason.

If you would like to try going through https://wiki.apache.org/cassandra/ArchitectureGossip and updating (a few things have changed) as well as formatting for RST, that would be quite helpful and an excellent way to go through the current code base and learn more.

Thanks for the patch! I've modified it very slightly, hope you don't mind too much.

Hi @Fuud - eb717f154bd24453273d7175006fdef75e5724c2 has been merged and CASSANDRA-13652 is closed. Is this PR still needed? If not, can you close it (the committers are unable to close it on your behalf)?
@jeffjirsa Sorry, my fault.
This PR was merged in 5dc79aafceb8dd1b7a985b262f128c59bedb5bf6.
PR has been merged, thank you!

@iksaif,
 continuing the conversation from [CASSANDRA-10496](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-10496).

> What do you mean by "changing locations isn't supported" ?

`switchCompactionLocation(..)` is a public method and can be called from other places, when rows need to now be written to a new sstable in a new location. That's why [here](https://github.com/thelastpickle/cassandra/commit/a34a72391bb2847b3bd6ed93b4306199ddf3a991#diff-19359d40a9c932efdebc62a067ed4390R40) i paired writers by their location, so if a location changes the writer can also change.

> > Marcus' original idea was to create only two sstables per TWCS window.
>
> Currently it will create up to "minThreshold" sstables …

I'm not too sure I get that. The code you referenced is about which bucket is up for compaction, not how many writers to use during a bucket's compaction.
Marcus' idea was to only create two sstables per bucket, one that contains all the rows that belong in the bucket, and another for old data that's been streamed in late. Therefore `SplittingTimeWindowCompactionWriter. writersByBounds` should be a fixed array of size 2. The splitting approach as describe in  `SplittingTimeWindowCompactionWriter`'s class apidoc: splitting in half, then half, down to 50Mb; is quite different to the original idea.

> > shouldn't the bucket be based of the maxTimestamp? see `getBuckets(..)` and `newestBucket(..)`
>
> getBuckets() currently use maxTimestamp, , which isn't available (currently) in the compaction task

@krummas ?

> Are you talking about sstables generated before this patch ?

Yes.
eb717f1 has been merged and CASSANDRA-13652 is closed.

* `switchCompactionLocation(..)`: go it, will update code
* `Marcus' idea was to only create two sstables per bucket`: ok, I missed that. I'll see what I can get done here. Also the docstring was wrong.
* `sstables generated before this patch`: I wanted to think about the upgrade strategy only when the other questions would have been answered. If this get shipped before 4.0 is released this could be a non-issue.

Added the patch for the same here
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-13901

Patches like this (and similarly, patches that cleanup whitespace issues) may be correct, but cause a lot of headache for people working on more meaningful (bugfix, feature addition) patches when it comes time to merge. You may want to open a full JIRA to discuss it (you can leave the PR here, we'll close it if/when we merge the patch).

I don't know how JIRA works. I just built the project locally and received no errors or warnings.
By the way, this refactoring was done by a automated tool.

It is extremely unlikely the project will merge patches that are just refactors for the sake of refactors. Please see our “how to contribute” guide:

https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/development/patches.html#patches

Thanks for your contribution, Sahal!
I've opened a ticket on your patch for further discussion and to track progress:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-14065

For the future, please try to avoid opening new PRs for amending changes. You can simply add new commits to an existing PR instead.

I have added a flag in order to keep index files in the index release function.
This way I can prevent deletions.

Any advise on the patch ?

sure.

Hi @Benmartin92 , That looks like a perfectly reasonable patch. It appears that @bdeggleston also noticed this in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-14091 (a week or so after your patch). Unfortunately, I don't think anyone noticed your patch, probably because we don't typically use Github PRs (ASF repo isn't writable on github, so we can't merge this PR directly) - our contribution workflow is through JIRA. Appreciate the contribution, sorry we didn't see it in time.
what the hell - it's the wrong branch. My mistake, clearly.
I can't close this, but we should close it in favor of https://github.com/apache/cassandra/pull/188 which is this rebased yet again.
Pull
Wrong repo!

I appreciate the content however there are other parts of the architecture that need to be described too.  The illustration has a blue color that I think would clash with the green colored theme of the website.  The illustration probably isn't needed as the text describes peer to peer and the illustration doesn't add anything really.  

Bottom line is the text needs more content about the architecture added.
Please close the PR as the patch already has been merged in d10e6ac606c6b484c75bb850de7a754b75ad5eca
PR can be closed as this already has been fixed in 51511697254615b570f4162bbcd2baee23a234e9
Closing this pull request as thanks to @jasobrown those changes were pushed to 3.11 with some editorial changes.
@aweisberg since this has been merged should we close this one out?
closing as 7544 has been committed.
we can close this now that 7544 is committed
I am curious about the status of this work.
I likely won't have time to finish, and `unsafe_aggressive_sstable_expiration` is good enough for our usecase now.

I realize that it's been a while since the PR was opened. But do you remember why you had to switch the `prepare_loop()` and `while not self.stop` lines? Why do we have to init readline/prepare_loop on each iteration?

I realized that `self.tty` had to be changed by `self.interactive` when i was developing.
Now I noticed I should do the process before the `with self.prepare_loop()` in line 872.
Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-14385

Thanks for cleaning those items up.

+1 from me. Committers, do please merge.
Also I haven't reviewed the test changes yet.

Hey one thing I found is that the various implementations of ReplicaSet and ReplicaList (immutable, singleton) don't handle equals and hash code correctly.

You probably want an AbstractReplicaSet and AbstractReplicaList with no storage that define how equals (against any derived class of AbstractReplicaSet or List depending).
Uh I may have brain farted there. I don't think there is an issue.

I'm not totally crazy. I added a ReplicaSet.of method and when I call it I get Replicas.of instead which is a little nuts.

What I don't get is I am explicit invoking ReplicaSet and it's a static method! This is some of the craziest language behavior I have ever seen.
Should we have this validation enabled for utests and dtests and maybe have the dtests fail if these validations fail?

bq. You probably want an AbstractReplicaSet and AbstractReplicaList with no storage that define how equals (against any derived class of AbstractReplicaSet or List depending).

fixed, moved equals and hashCode up to base class
Reminder we wanted to disallow the creation of transiently replicated keyspaces in mixed version clusters.

Can we get more thorough tests for Replicas, ReplicaList, and ReplicaSet. I'm not looking for 100% coverage, but things like equality and hash code, order sensitivity of hash code output and equals results.

ReplicaList, containsEndpoint, filter, intersect, subList, normalizeByRange (I am not sure this is equivalent to Range.normalize they look very different).

Then tests for methods in Replicas like containsEndpoint.

Some test failures https://circleci.com/gh/aweisberg/cassandra/1223#tests/containers/60
https://circleci.com/gh/aweisberg/cassandra/1225#tests/containers/46
The dtest failure I suspect is it failing to notice the node move and push the notification. I haven't run it multiple times yet to see if it is flakey or not.

Sankalp made the suggestion that we should forbid altering transient replication during range movements and other things that might conflict. Currently we allow RF changes without really checking if it is safe to do so and there is maybe no reason to continue that.
This patch contains the potential for a ConcurrentModificationException.  The HashMap at line 47 of DataResolver.java should probably be a ConcurrentHashMap.
@tedcarroll this PR is out of date. See the patch on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-10726

> ReplicaSet can be a map from endpoint to replica, which might help with both iteration and access to endpoints

Should it be keyed by endpoint or range? I don't think what we want is consistent.
